WonderkidAnswered on 01 Mar 2019I will not recommend regular saving plans since you are young.If you are new to investing and have yet to experience the roller coaster ride of the stock market, I will suggest the following which in a way is my TUB Investing Mindset:Have about $3k to $5k of DISPOSABLE INCOME/CASHInvest in max of 3 stocks that you really like and have your investment thesis ready.Have a long mindset when investingExperience for the next 6 months and see if you feel you are suitable to invest.Hope this explains.0 comments0

Zann ChuaLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 01 Mar 2019Hello! How much would be a good amount would largely depend on yourself and how much cash that you have on hand that you are comfortable with putting into investing. Personally, I would put around $100-200 each month for investment in terms of a regular savings plan. Starting to invest as early as possible even though the sum may be small is a good start and much better than not investing at all! hope this helps.0 comments0

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 01 Mar 2019There's not really a recommended amount. After setting aside money for an emergency fund, you can start with any amount! Just $100 is needed to start investing monthly using a Regular Savings Plan provided by most of the banks :)0 comments0

Even as a student starting with just a hundred or two every month is already a good start.0 comments0
